intro: Streptogyna, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique, often intricate floral structures and is native to various regions in Africa, Madagascar, and the Arabian Peninsula. The plants typically grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Streptogyna species often have small, delicate flowers with specialized pollination mechanisms. Their botanical significance lies in their ecological roles and contributions to biodiversity in their native habitats.
